concept.title: Air Induction System
concept.shortdesc: Air enters the induction system through air scoops above the nacelle. The ram action of the air mass supplies the energy to move cold air through the system.

conbody.p: A carburetor heat control provides an alternate source of air, allowing heated air to flow from around the cylinder heads to the system.

Normally there is a baffle in the air-mixing chamber. Air entering horizontally through the cold-air intake is deflected down into the carburetor inlet. Under dusty atmospheric conditions an air filter in the air-mixing chamber replaces the baffle.
